author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He is with all; He is not far away.

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He is the Cause of causes, ever-present here and now. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

translation.text: Hearing His Name, one comes to life.

However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

translation.text: Pain is dispelled; peace and tranquility come to dwell within.

This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. text: ਮੁਨਿ ਜਨ ਤਾ ਕੀ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The silent sages serve Him. ||1||

transliteration.text: mun jan tā kī sēv karē .1.

This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. translation.text: Forever and ever, serve the Merciful Lord. ||2||

translation.text: Righteous justice is dispensed in His Court forever.

translation.text: He is carefree, and owes allegiance to no one.

text: ਰੇ ਮਨ ਮੇਰੇ ਤੂ ਤਾ ਕਉ ਜਾਪਿ ॥੩॥

translation.text: O my mind, meditate on Him. ||3||

transliteration.text: rē man mērē tū tā kau jāp .3.

translation.text: Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl, Du-Padas:

text: ਜੀਉ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਧਨੁ ਰਾਸਿ ਮੇਰੀ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਏਕ ਕਾਰਨ ਕਰਨਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: My soul, body, wealth and capital belong to the One God, the Cause of causes. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jīu pind dhan rās mērī prabh ēk kāran karanā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

text: ਸਿਮਰਿ ਸਿਮਰਿ ਸਦਾ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਈਐ ਜੀਵਣੈ ਕਾ ਮੂਲੁ ॥

translation.text: Meditating, meditating in remembrance on Him, I have found everlasting peace. He is the source of life.

transliteration.text: simar simar sadā sukh pāīai jīvanai kā mūl .

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

text: ਰਵਿ ਰਹਿਆ ਸਰਬਤ ਠਾਈ ਸੂਖਮੋ ਅਸਥੂਲ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He is all-pervading, permeating all places; He is in subtle essence and manifest form. ||1||

transliteration.text: rav rahiā sarabat thāī sūkhamō asathūl .1.

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’.
